result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonard C White

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Leonard C White appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Leonard C White.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Powell.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard C White appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Leonard C White.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present. Unable to proceed due to court congestion. Defense moves to dismiss. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leonard C White not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with L.L. and A.D. R-P
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Leonard C White in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Leonard C White in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Leonard C White
Current: 4646 W. Medford, Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 07-17-2022)
Prior: 4648 West Medford Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
